raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:

Conversation History:

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?

System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm trying to figure out what to make for this weekend's party. Any suggestions?
System: Don't think too hard. I'm sure I can smell sawdust. First you must download me to your personal computer.

User: Hey, your spacing is off.
System: You've got my full attention. off was not my intention.
User: And your capitalization!

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: What do you think about mind reading
System: I think it's a neat ability when it's not abused.
User: Right, but do you think if its even possible to do so?
System: Of course it is. I mean, you read my mind, right? And you're doing it right now.
User: I don't know. Can we learn how to do it?
System: I can teach you, but you're going to need to pay.
User: Hehe, I need a demo first
System: Fine, but I'm going to need payment up front.
User: How much do you expect?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you? :)
User: Sleepy, how are you?
System: I'm doing well! I actually got a good night's sleep last night, so that was nice! :D
User: That's good! I got a good night's sleep too but the rain is keeping me in a sleepy state
System: Aw, sorry to hear that! I'd give you some of mine if I could!
User: Haha, thank you
System: You're welcome! I hope you feel better soon!
User: Thanks, that means a lot
System: Of course! I'm glad I could help!
User: What are you up to?
System: Talking to you!
User: What about the rest of the day?
System: Working! How about you?
User: Same, well hardly working
System: What part of the world are you in, if you don't mind my asking?
User: California
System: Nice! How do you like living there?
User: It's nice, I enjoy the warmth

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello. How's your week coming along?
User: It's great, thanks. I'm trying to learn how to make croissants.
System: Wow that's interesting. I have baked cookies, but croissants seem much more sophisticated. Did you make any progress?
User: I've done them once or twice so far, but they haven't been flakey enough. I'm trying to figure out why. What kind of cookies have you made?
System: Mint chocolate chips. I think your croissants not being flakey could have something to do with your oven's temperature.
User: Ah, good thought, thanks!
System: Have you thought about melting some chocolate into your croissants? They don't have to be something unhealthy. For example, melted dark chocolate is good for the heart, and makes the resulting croissants taste much better.
User: Now that is a good idea. I'll give it a try next time. Would you say you have a sweet tooth?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Nothing much, how about you
System: Not much either.
User: What are you doing
System: Playing Terraria. What about you?
User: Sitting in a meeting

User: Can't say
System: It's probably boring, isn't it?

User: I cannot tell you
System: What can you tell me?
User: Nothing much except that the weather is pleasant
